definition: swing (seat hung from a frame or branch)

sentences.english: A three-passenger swing hung from the ceiling of the broad front porch.
sentences.chinese: 寬闊的門廊上掛着一個可供三人玩的鞦韆。

sentences.english: It has a mane and long horsey nose — must be a horse swing.
sentences.chinese: 有鬃毛和長長馬一樣鼻子的那就是小馬駒鞦韆了。

sentences.english: The excitement of swinging on a swing as high as you possibly can.
sentences.chinese: 在鞦韆上盪到你可能達到的極限高度。

sentences.english: The girl who first gets the flower wins the game.
sentences.chinese: 開始盪鞦韆比賽之前，人們會在高處放一枝花。

sentences.english: She swung to and fro on the swing.
Next, I pushed her on the swing.
” while two laughing children pushed her.
sentences.chinese: 兩個孩子正樂不可支地推那鞦韆。

sentences.english: The kite is joyful my sky, the swing is swinging rosy clouds.
sentences.chinese: 風箏快樂着我的天空，鞦韆蕩起一片雲霞。

sentences.english: And when that day comes, love, you will remember me.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，你會蕩起鞦韆，越來越高，前所未有。

sentences.english: Jinyan dust Hong Hong dark wind, the wind purple red multicolored Swing Club.
sentences.chinese: 金雁塵香暗風弘，紅繢風紫閣鞦韆。

sentences.english: Light a man sit on the swing swing, Moonlight, Star bright.
sentences.chinese: 一個人坐在鞦韆上輕蕩，月夜下，星光璀璨。

sentences.english: Pale blue swing, the wind butterfly clothing.
sentences.chinese: 月白鞦韆地，風吹蛺蝶衣。

sentences.english: David got a boo-boo on his knee from falling off the swing.
sentences.chinese: 大衛從鞦韆跌下來，膝蓋上留下一個疤。

definition: oriole or various birds of the Sylvidae family including warblers
(literary) crisscross/uneven/disorderly/rim of the eye/variant of 欄杆|栏杆[lan2 gan1]
edge of the water/waterside/shore (of sea, lake or river)
The Broken Bridge (at West Lake in Hangzhou)
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
